intro: Bulbostylis lanata var. xyrioides, commonly known as the woolly bulbostylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and hairy, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers. It is typically found in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in certain regions.
